lines.gurmukhi: jYsy krpUr lon eyk sy idKweI dyq kysr ksuMB smsr ArunweI kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Karapoor Lon Ayk Say Dikhaaee Dayta , Kaysar Kasounbh Samasar Arounaaee Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a camphor and salt being white look alike, petals of saffron and safflower (Carthamus tinctorious) being red, look the same.

lines.gurmukhi: rUpo kwNsI dono jYsy aUjl brn hoq kwjr AO coAw hY smwn sRXwmqweI kY
lines.transliteration_english: Roopo Kaansee Dono Jaisay Oojal Baran Hota , Kaajar Au Choaa Hai Samaan Syaamataaee Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as silver and bronze shine alike, collyrium and incense stick ash mixed with oil have the same blackness.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdRwien Pl AMmiRq Pl pIq sm hIrw AO Ptk sm rUp hY idKweI kY
lines.transliteration_english: Indraain Dhal Anmrit Dhal Peet Sama , Heeraa Au Dhatak Sam Roop Hai Dikhaaee Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as colocynth (Tuma) and mango both being yellow look alike, a diamond and a marble bear the same hue.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy Kl diRsit mYN AswD swD sm dyh bUJq ibbykI jl jugiq smweI kY ]597]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Khal Drisati Main Asaadh Saadh Sam Dayha , Boojhat Bibaykee Jal Jougati Samaaee Kai ?597?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, in the eyes of a foolish person, good and bad men are seen the same, but one who is a knowledgeable person with Guru's teachings, knows how to separate milk from water like a swan. He has the ability to distinguish between a saint and a sinner.
